Posted By: Templar314 (10/17/2010 12:47:58 PM)

posts.post_content:
It was meant to work in a white/black deck with [Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism)--both Urza's saga. I remember the drafts of these two and going to town on people in 2 turns.  
  
People forget how, back in the day with Magic, black cards always had some sort of trade off that would ultimately give you the advantage in the end (if you didn't wind up killing yourself before then).
posts.html:
It was meant to work in a white/black deck with Pacifism--both Urza's saga. I remember the drafts of these two and going to town on people in 2 turns.

Posted By: raptorman333 (11/11/2009 6:17:28 AM)

posts.post_content:
Does anybody know why this is not a *Human Minion*?  
Yeah, i can see that shadow, so this is possibly not his true form.  
But on the other hand, [Possessed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Possessed) creatures also have both types.  
  
By the way, talking about her being awake or not - combining her with [Sigil of Sleep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil of Sleep) is coincidentally in fact a decent combo, given that your opponent has other creatures outside.
posts.html:

Yeah, i can see that shadow, so this is possibly not his true form.
But on the other hand, Possessed creatures also have both types.

posts.post_content:
Sigil of sleep doesn't work with this.  
If your opponent is smart, he'll return the sleeper agent to your hand, (owner, not controller) at which point the Sigil disappears. And you have just wasted two mana.

Posted By: MithosFall (5/17/2012 7:52:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I see this card as a legacy on the theme that [Curse Artifact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse Artifact) and [Cursed Land](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cursed Land) began. In fact, in Urza's Saga there was another card on the theme - [Parasitic Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parasitic Bond). This card is possible the best of the group, though, because of its great casting cost and flexibility. Although as @Arachobia pointed out it can be a bit of a gamble.
posts.html:
I see this card as a legacy on the theme that Curse Artifact and Cursed Land began. In fact, in Urza's Saga there was another card on the theme - Parasitic Bond. This card is possible the best of the group, though, because of its great casting cost and flexibility. Although as @Arachobia pointed out it can be a bit of a gamble.

posts.post_content: Within mono-black, I find that this, [Pestilence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence), and [Cemetery Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cemetery Gate) can combo. Maybe not THE most worthwhile strategy ever, but you can use the gates to block it, pestilence to add some damage per turn, and if things get out of hand with other creatures your opponent has, pestilence can wipe them all. \*shrug\*

posts.post_content: @Kryptnyt - I get that the art is Xantcha, but surely the card isn't representative of her? I'm almost finished reading Planeswalker at the moment, and at no point was Xantcha ever really a sleeper agent as the Phyrexians meant them to be. My guess is they had the art for Xantcha done, and decided against making her a card and just stuck it on the card they'd made to be the true sleepers.
